property.name: hadoop.tmp.dir
property.description: A base for other temporary directories.

property.name: fs.default.name
property.description: The old FileSystem used by FsShell.

property.name: fs.gs.working.dir
property.description: The directory relative gs: uris resolve in inside of the default bucket.

property.name: fs.gs.system.bucket
property.description: GCS bucket to use as a default bucket if fs.default.name is not a gs: uri.

property.name: fs.gs.metadata.cache.directory
property.description: Only used if fs.gs.metadata.cache.type is FILESYSTEM_BACKED, specifies the local path to use as the base path for storing mirrored GCS metadata. Must be an absolute path, must be a directory, and must be fully readable/writable/executable by any user running processes which use the GCS connector.

property.name: fs.gs.project.id
property.description: Google Cloud Project ID with access to configured GCS buckets.

property.name: fs.gs.implicit.dir.infer.enable
property.description: If set, we create and return in-memory directory objects on the fly when no backing object exists, but we know there are files with the same prefix.

property.name: fs.gs.application.name.suffix
property.description: Appended to the user-agent header for API requests to GCS to help identify the traffic as coming from Dataproc.

property.name: fs.gs.metadata.cache.type
property.description: Specifies which implementation of DirectoryListCache to use for supplementing GCS API &quot;list&quot; requests. Supported implementations: IN_MEMORY: Enforces immediate consistency within same Java process. FILESYSTEM_BACKED: Enforces consistency across all cooperating processes pointed at the same local mirror directory, which may be an NFS directory for massively-distributed coordination.
